content.description:
Climb a crack on the southwest side of the dome.  Chickenheads and other features lead to a wide crack with a slight overhang.  Pulling through the crack is dirty and the crux.  Once through the dirty crack, climb past a tree to a hand crack (second easier crux) and belay on gear.  A large, detached boulder at the top provides a good anchor.

Descend by scrambling down the north side of the dome.

Start off standing on a good foot ledge about 1' off the ground. Then reach to a crimp above. Traverse to the left until you find a good hold to work to the top with. You can walk over the top and scramble down a little gully that is actually the base of Bombardier Dome.

The climb has a slight incline, but the holds are not super easy either. So I feel it's a good little problem to practice on. Plus, there are no boulder routes advertised in the area, so it's nice to have something to climb without rope.
content.protection: Use a pad if you want.
content.location: This is the big rock jutting out from the west side of Bombardier Dome, adjacent to the north side of the hiking trail.

content.description:
Climb the prominent, low angle gully with some vegetation on the south face of the Bomardier Dome.

Pitch 1: 5.3.  Belay at a head-wall as the route steepens (~140-150 feet).

Pitch 2: 5.5.  Continue up the crack and belay at some trees near the top.  Watch for loose rocks beyond the headwall (~70-90 feet).

Descend by scrambling down the north side of Bombardier Dome.
content.protection: A limited rack.  Larger cams for the first pitch and smaller to mid-size cams for the upper pitch.

climbs.name: Da Vinci's Robot
climbs.fa: Alex A. Ian W. Kirk Miller

content.description: Climb a slab to a steeper part, the crux. There is a variation on the upper part that is 5.10 staying left of the bolt line.

Climb a steep face  10 feet right of the black stained dihedral,

Volo

. This has thin and technical climbing. It will test your foot work skills.
content.location: Follow the Climbers' Access Trail to the Northwest corner of Bombardier Dome. Look for a sign to the trail. Where trail splits, go left.
